welcome.name: Welcome
welcome.content:
@devartsite/DiscordBot

DiscordBot is a node.js module that allows you to build a Discord Bot easily
Easy to use, the important thing is to read our documentation

# Welcome! Welcome to the DiscordBot v2 documentation. # About Discord is an extend of discord.js. *discord.js is a powerful [Node.js](https://nodejs.org) module that allows you to easily interact with the [Discord API](https://discord.com/developers/docs/intro).* - *Object-oriented* - *Predictable abstractions* - *Performant* - *100% coverage of the Discord API* # Installation **Node.js 12.0.0 or newer is required.** ``` sh npm i @devartsite/discordbot ``` # Basic example ``` js const { DiscordBot, Command } = require('@devartsite/discordbot') const client = new DiscordBot({ ggid: 'my guild id', gcid: 'my channel id', dev: 'my name', prefix: '&prefix' }) const myCommand = new Command(client, { alias: ['ping'], name: ':blue_circle: Ping', description: [ ':arrow_right: ``ping`` Respond Pong!!.' ], group: 'ping', script: async function (message) { message.channel.send('Pong!!') } }) client.login('my token').then(() => { console.log('Bot started and ready') }).catch(console.error) ``` - By default DiscordBot integrates a [Help Module](https://github.com/DevArtSite/DiscordBot/tree/master/modules/Help) # Module implementation ```sh DiscordBot-project ├── modules │ ├── index.js │ ├── commands.js │ ├── methods.js │ ├── responses.js │ └── events.js └── index.js ``` # Links - [Website](https://discord.js.org/) ([source](https://github.com/discordjs/website)) - [discord.js Website](https://discord.js.org/) ([source](https://github.com/discordjs/website)) - [discord.js Documentation](https://discord.js.org/#/docs/main/master/general/welcome) # Help If you don't understand something in the documentation, you are experiencing problems, or you just need a gentle nudge in the right direction, please don't hesitate to join our official [Discord.js Server](https://discord.gg/bRCvFy9).

ping.name: Ping

classes.name: ClientDiscordBot
classes.description: Represents the Discord bot in logged in client’s.

props.name: ggid
props.description: The ggid (global guild id) is the id of the developer’s guild

props.name: gcid
props.description: The gcid (global channel id) is the id of the developer’s channel on developer’s guild

props.name: dev
props.description: The dev is the name of the main developer

props.name: prefix
props.description: The prefix is a character string to recognize a command of a message

props.name: dbname
props.description: The dbname is a name of mongo database

props.name: customHelp
props.description: The customHelp is an object containing the title and custom description for the help command

props.name: useDefaultModule
props.description: Default module selection enabled when client login

methods.name: MessageEmbed
examples: client.MessageEmbed({ title: 'My cool title', description: 'My awsome description' })

params.name: data
params.description: Whether to skip the cache check and request the API

methods.name: login
methods.description: Logs the client in, establishing a websocket connection to Discord.

params.name: token
params.description: Token of the account to log in with

events.name: command
events.description: Emitted whenever a command is executed.

params.name: command
params.description: The guild that has become unavailable

params.name: module
params.description: Should be Module if is command from module or Client if is a command out of module context

props.name: messages
props.description: The COllection messages of this command

methods.name: push
methods.description: Push this command to client & module commands collection if available

classes.name: CommandMessage
classes.description: Represents the Message with command properties.

props.name: responses
props.description: The responses Collection of this message if this message is a command request

props.name: request
props.description: The request of this message if this message is a command response

props.name: isCommandResponse
props.description: Check if message is a commmand response

props.name: isCommandRequest
props.description: Check if message is a commmand request

props.name: prefixed
props.description: Check if message content contain client prefix

props.name: command
props.description: Get Command message from current message or request message

methods.name: execute
methods.description: The execution of command script if this message is command

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Replies to the message.Set request properties to the returned CommandMessageSet this response properties with the returned CommandMessage
examples: // Reply to a messagemessage.reply('Hey, I\'m a reply!')  .then(() => console.log(`Sent a reply to ${message.author.username}`))  .catch(console.error)

methods.name: replyEmbed
methods.description: Replies embed to the message.Set request properties to the returned CommandMessageSet this response properties with the returned CommandMessage
examples: // Reply embed to a messageconst embed = client.MessageEmbed({ title: 'My cool title', description: 'My awsome description' })  .addField('field name', 'field value')message.reply(embed)  .then(() => console.log(`Sent a reply embed to ${message.author.username}`))  .catch(console.error)

props.name: autostart
props.description: Determines whether the module should be integrated into the bot when it login

props.name: script
props.description: The main script of this module

props.name: _commands
props.description: Commands by inclusion of this module

props.name: _events
props.description: Events by inclusion of this module

props.name: responses
props.description: Commands by inclusion of this module

props.name: commands
props.description: The commands Collection of this module

methods.name: existFile
methods.description: Check if the file or folder exists

methods.name: run
methods.description: Run the main script of this module

props.name: modulesPath
props.description: The string path to custom modules folder

props.name: defaultPath
props.description: The string path to default modules folder

methods.name: load
methods.description: Instantiates all new modules in the module folder

methods.name: isDefaultEnabled
methods.description: Test if it is a default module and should be enabled

params.name: path
params.description: Resolved path to default module folder

methods.name: init
methods.description: Call default and custom module instantiation when client login

methods.name: start
methods.description: Runs the main scripts of all modules when client login

typedefs.name: ClientDiscordBotOptions
typedefs.description: DiscordBot Options.

props.name: gcid
props.description: Id of the developer’s channel on developer’s guild

props.name: prefix
props.description: Character string to recognize a command of a message

typedefs.name: HelpEmbedOptions
typedefs.description: HelpEmbedOptions Options.

props.name: contentlimited
props.description: Content description if the real description of command

typedefs.name: TitleHelpFunction
typedefs.description: TitleHelpFunction function.

typedefs.name: DescriptionHelpFunction
typedefs.description: DescriptionHelpFunction function.

typedefs.name: ContentHelpLimited
typedefs.description: ContentLimited is content description if the real description of command is too long to be displayed.

typedefs.name: EmojisHelp
typedefs.description: EmojisHelp function.

typedefs.name: EmbedData
typedefs.description: Data MessageEmbed.

typedefs.name: EmbedDataFooter
typedefs.description: Data MessageEmbed Footer.

props.name: text
props.description: text The text of the footer

props.name: iconUrl
props.description: The icon URL of the footer

typedefs.name: ColorResolvable
typedefs.description: Can be a number, hex string, an RGB array like:

typedefs.name: Snowflake
typedefs.description: A Twitter snowflake, except the epoch is 2015-01-01T00:00:00.000Z

typedefs.name: MongooseConnection
typedefs.description: Mongodb connection

typedefs.name: Collection
typedefs.description: A Map with additional utility methods. This is used throughout discord.js rather than Arrays for anything that has an ID, for significantly improved performance and ease-of-use.

typedefs.name: Message
typedefs.description: Represents a message on Discord.

typedefs.name: CommandOptions
typedefs.description: Command Options.

props.name: script
props.description: The script main function of command

typedefs.name: CommandScriptFunction
typedefs.description: Main function of a command```js// In this function "this" can be used end return the instance of the commandasync function () { }// orfunction () { }// In this function "this" cannot be used and return that: {}, an object unusableasyn () => { }// or() => { }```- In this function "this" is the instance of the command

typedefs.name: StringResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give a string. This can be:* A string* An array (joined with a new line delimiter to give a string)* Any value

typedefs.name: APIMessage
typedefs.description: Represents a message to be sent to the API.

typedefs.name: MessageOptions
typedefs.description: Options provided when sending or editing a message.

typedefs.name: MessageAdditions
typedefs.description: Additional items that can be sent with a message.

typedefs.name: MessageEmbed
typedefs.description: Represents an embed in a message (image/video preview, rich embed, etc.)

typedefs.name: ModuleScriptFunction
typedefs.description: Main function of a {@link Module}```js// In this function "this" can be used end return the instance of the {@link Module}async function () { }// orfunction () { }// In this function "this" cannot be used and return that: {}, an object unusableasyn () => { }// or() => { }```- In this function "this" is the {@link Module} instance

typedefs.name: ModuleMethodsObject
typedefs.description: The Methods object of a {@link Module}```jsModuleMethodsObject = {  myMethods: function () {    // Can do stuff with "this.module"  }}```

typedefs.name: ModuleMethodsFunction
typedefs.description: The ModuleMethodsFunction function of a {@link Module}- In this function "this" is the methods object but when the {@link Module} is instantiated, it is transferred to the methods object- To access to the module you need to use that in your function```jsthis.module``````js// In this function "this" can be usedasync function () { }function () { }// In this function "this" cannot be usedasync () => { }() => { }```- In this function "this" is the an object with "module" variable containing the {@link Module} instance

typedefs.name: ModuleEventsObject
typedefs.description: The ModuleEventsObject is object which lists the functions to associate to the available event```jsModuleEventsObject = {  ready: function () {   // do stuff  }}```

typedefs.name: ModuleEventFunction
typedefs.description: The ModuleEventFunction is a function- To access to the module you need to use that in your function```jsconst module = this.modules.find(({ name }) => name === 'My module name')```- In this function "this" is the {@link ClientDiscordBot} instance```js// In this function "this" can be usedasync function () { }function () { }// In this function "this" cannot be usedasync () => { }() => { }```

typedefs.name: resolvedPath
typedefs.description: Path resolved with "resolve" function from node.js module "path"
